article.title: Compound_turbine
article.paragraph: Acompound turbineis asteam turbinein which there are two casings, a high-pressurecasing and a low-pressure casing, operating in concert to extract work from a single source of steam. The steam is partially expanded in the high-pressure casing, then exhausted to the low-pressure casing.
article.heading: Tandem compound or cross compound
article.paragraph: The rotor arrangement can be either tandem-compound in which the twoaxlesare joined end to end, or cross-compound in which the two turbines have separate axles. In the cross-compound case two separategenerator (device)generatorsare usually supplied, although a gearbox can reduce this to one.
article.heading: Advantages
article.paragraph: File:Niederdruck-Turbinenlufer.jpgthumb200pxDivided flow low-pressure turbine rotor. Steam enters at the centre and expands in both directionsThe principal advantages of compound turbines are the reduction in size of any one casing, the confinement of the highest pressure to the smaller casing (which may be made of stronger and more expensive materials) and the possibility of divided flow in the low-pressure casing for the purpose of equalizing end thrusts.
